availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Shields (Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, resident and inmate)

body.p: Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Convicted of grand larceny by the Fayette Circuit Court in February 1859. Incarcerated in the Fayette County Jail in Lexington, Kentucky, in 1860. Pardoned by Governor Beriah Magoffin on December 19, 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, p. 596.
KYR-0001-020-0237.
